recipes.name: Creamy Mushroom Pasta
cooking_method: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and cook until soft and fragrant.
Add mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and are tender.
Stir in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese, and cook until sauce thickens.
Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet and toss to coat with sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Baked Chicken and Vegetables
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 375Â°F.
Place chicken breasts in a baking dish.
Arrange diced potatoes, sliced carrots, zucchini, and red bell pepper around chicken.
Drizzle olive oil over chicken and vegetables.
Sprinkle with oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
cooking_method: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Add sliced beef and stir-fry until browned and cooked through.
Remove beef from skillet and set aside.
Add broccoli, carrots, red bell pepper, onion, and garlic to the skillet.
Stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, cornstarch, water, salt, and pepper.
Add cooked beef back to the skillet, and pour the sauce over the beef and vegetables.
Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, or until sauce has thickened.
